userPromptEntries.prompt: The user's current OS is: Linux I am working in a workspace with the following folders: - /home/pb/code/tech-demos I am working in a workspace that has the following structure: ``` ``` This is the state of the context at this point in the conversation. The view of the workspace structure may be truncated. You can use tools to collect more context if needed. [Chronological Review: Walk through conversation phases: initial request → exploration → implementation → debugging → current state] - Phase 1 (Scaffold + tooling): User asked for a React site deployable to GitHub Pages with modern build tools. The project was scaffolded with Vite + React, then migrated to TypeScript. Legacy `.jsx` files were removed. ESLint + Prettier were added with modern TypeScript/React rules and scripts (`lint`, `lint:fix`). - Phase 2 (Portfolio + 3D hero): Built a portfolio homepage for a backend dev with a React Three Fiber scene: rotating rounded cube, glass-like material, environment lighting, and an in-canvas slider controlling glass transmission. Hash routing was used for GitHub Pages compatibility. - Phase 3 (Interactivity + icons): Reworked cube face navigation to in-scene meshes; added hover cursor, press-in animation, selection glow, external “Selected skill” panel, and improved skill icons to be flatter. Iterated on GraphQL and Kubernetes icons, fixing clickability issues by geometry/material adjustments and face rotation corrections. - Phase 4 (GitHub Pages deployment): Switched to branch deployment via `docs/` output and ensured assets load correctly with proper base paths and `.nojekyll`. - Phase 5 (Prompt logging + viewer): User requested logging “all user inputs” into JSON and a viewer page. Implemented an append-only JSON log, created a dedicated viewer route/page, added UI polish and search, and added “Copilot instructions” + a helper script to append new prompts. - Phase 6 (Full transcript backfill): User insisted “whole prompt” history exists “in the chat”; user provided a `full-chat` file. The agent parsed it and backfilled the JSON log with verbatim prompts. - Phase 7 (Refactor modules): User requested `src/pages` sibling to `src/components` and `src/data` for data files; moved page components and data accordingly, updated imports/scripts, and verified build. - Phase 8 (Build warning fix): User requested fixing Vite’s CJS Node API deprecation warning and chunk-size warnings; config was adjusted and renamed so builds are clean. - Phase 9 (Current work): User requested richer project detail pages (tech used, learnings, screenshot, live link) and also asked for a future “copilot skill” that clones/scans repos. The agent began implementing the data model and Project details UI. [Intent Mapping: List each explicit user request with message context] - “start creating a website…deploy to github pages…react app…basic and modern build tools” - “make it typescript” + remove leftover `.jsx` - “add a linter that’s super modern…Add lint and lint:fix scripts” - “create a really cool portfolio…react-three-fiber…rotating cube” - “semi-transparent…realistic glass…add a slider in the threejs canvas” - “create a linked in widget…profile image…background image” - “extract all components into their own components module” - “make icons flatter…fix GraphQL…do the same for Kubernetes” - “add text under each icon…only show when cube face is most prominently facing camera…fade in/out” - “put all user inputs into a json…new page ‘Generated with Agent Prompts’…append on new prompts (add instructions)” - “viewer nicer…professional…modern…easily searchable…show whole prompt” - “create pages module sibling of components…data module…move profile.ts etc” - “Fix this warning: Vite CJS Node API deprecated…chunk warnings” - “project details page: tech used, learnings, screenshot, live link” - “new copilot skill: clone repo to temp dir and scan/extract project info” [Technical Inventory: Catalog all technologies, patterns, and decisions mentioned] - Frontend: Vite v5, React 18, TypeScript. - Linting: ESLint + Prettier with modern TS/React rules; `lint` and `lint:fix`. - 3D: three.js, @react-three/fiber, @react-three/drei (RoundedBox, Environment, OrbitControls, Text, Html, Edges, useCursor). - Routing: `react-router-dom` with `HashRouter` for GitHub Pages. - Deployment: GitHub Pages branch deploy from `docs/`, `.nojekyll` postbuild. - Prompt logging system: - Append-only JSON log of user prompts (verbatim), timestamps, optional summary and files. - Viewer page with search/filtering, left list + detail panel, copy-to-clipboard. - Helper script to append log entries and avoid duplicates. - Repository instructions file requiring future prompt logging. - Build warning mitigation: - Vite config converted/treated as ESM by renaming to `.mjs`. - Increased chunk size warning threshold in Vite build config. [Code Archaeology: Document every file, function, and code change discussed] Key files impacted over the session (high level): - `src/components/CubeHeroScene.tsx`: R3F hero scene; cube faces; pointer events; hit-plane; press-in animation; label visibility based on face normal vs camera; smooth fade via per-label opacity damping. - `src/SkillMark3D.tsx`: Flat-ish icon glyphs; GraphQL and Kubernetes refined; materials fixed to avoid reuse issues; ensured no protruding geometry; ring geometry changes. - `src/pages/HomePage.tsx`: Portfolio hero layout; LinkedIn widget; projects list; links to Agent Prompts page. - `src/pages/AgentPromptsPage.tsx`: Modern prompt viewer; left preview + right detail; search; copy; back-to-home navigation. - `src/pages/ProjectPage.tsx`: Project detail view; recently enhanced to include screenshot, tech used, learnings, and live link (conditional rendering). - `src/data/profile.ts`, `src/data/projects.ts`, `src/data/agent-prompts.json`: Data moved into `src/data`; `projects.ts` type extended to include `liveUrl`, `screenshotUrl`, `techUsed`, `whatILearned`. - `src/App.tsx`: Routes updated to use `src/pages/*`. - `src/index.css`: Added styles for prompt viewer (toolbar/layout/list/detail); added styles for project screenshot/chips/list; integrated with existing site design language. - `scripts/append-agent-prompt.cjs`: Helper script updated to append structured entries and (after refactor) write to `src/data/agent-prompts.json`; includes duplicate-prevention logic. - `.github/copilot-instructions.md`: Instructions requiring appending verbatim prompts to the log; updated after moving log to `src/data`. - `vite.config.mjs`: Renamed from `.js` to `.mjs` to avoid deprecated CJS loading warning; build config includes outDir `docs/` and `chunkSizeWarningLimit`. - `full-chat` (repo file): Provided by user; parsed to backfill prompt log with verbatim user prompts. [Progress Assessment: What's done vs. pending with specific status] Done: - Portfolio site baseline and Pages deployment setup. - 3D cube hero with glass slider, interactive icons, labels that appear on most-facing face with fade. - Prompt logging system: JSON log, modern searchable viewer, append script, and instructions; backfilled from `full-chat`. - Refactor: created `src/pages` and `src/data`, moved files and updated imports. - Build warning fix: removed Vite CJS Node API warning; silenced chunk warning. In progress / pending: - Project details enrichment: Data model extended and ProjectPage updated to render richer fields; existing `projects` entries still need to be populated with tech/learnings/screenshot/live link. - “Copilot skill” request: a repo-scanning capability that clones a GitHub repo to a temp dir and extracts project info is not yet implemented (only discussed as the next planned piece). Needs design: clone strategy, extraction heuristics (README parsing, package.json, tech detection), and output format for `src/data/projects.ts`. [Context Validation: Verify all critical information for continuation is captured] - The project uses HashRouter and builds to `docs/` for GitHub Pages. - Prompt log is now located at `src/data/agent-prompts.json` and should be appended for every new prompt using the helper script (or manual edits). - Project detail page supports the new fields but data population and automation (repo scan) remain. - Build output should now be free of the CJS deprecation warning because Vite config is `.mjs`. [Recent Commands Analysis: Last agent commands executed, tool results (truncated if long), immediate pre-summarization state] Most recent operations (the ones immediately preceding this summarization request): 1) Read current project data + project detail page: - Opened `src/data/projects.ts` and `src/pages/ProjectPage.tsx` to assess current schema and render. - Found `Project` only had `slug`, `name`, `description`, optional `githubUrl`, `tags`, and ProjectPage only rendered title/desc/tags/GitHub link. 2) Applied edits to implement richer project details: - Updated `src/data/projects.ts`: - Added optional fields: `liveUrl`, `screenshotUrl`, `techUsed`, `whatILearned`. - Updated `src/pages/ProjectPage.tsx`: - Added “View Live App” CTA when `liveUrl` exists. - Added conditional sections: - Screenshot section rendering `` when `screenshotUrl` exists. - “Tech used” chips when `techUsed` exists. - “What I learned” bullet list when `whatILearned` exists. - Updated `src/index.css`: - Added `.projectScreenshot`, `.projectChips`, `.projectChip`, `.projectList` styles. 3) Immediate state at token-pressure point: - The agent had just completed the initial implementation for richer project detail rendering and styling. - The next planned work (not yet executed) was to implement the “repo scanner” capability (clone to temp directory, scan for tech/README links, generate structured data), and to populate real project entries with these new fields. Connection to overall user goals: - These edits directly address the user’s request to make the project detail page more informative (tech stack, learnings, screenshot, live link) and set up the schema needed for an automated repo-scanning tool to fill in those fields later. 1. Conversation Overview: - Primary Objectives: - “I want to start creating a website that I can deploy to github pages…react app…modern build tools” - “Yep, let’s make it typescript” / remove `.jsx` - “add a linter that’s super modern…Add lint and lint:fix scripts” - “create a really cool portfolio…react-three-fiber…rotating cube” - “make it semi-transparent like super realistic glass…add a slider” - “create a linked in widget…profile image…background image” - “do a pass on the icons…more flat…fix GraphQL…Kubernetes” - “add text underneith each icon…only show…fade in/out” - “put all of the user inputs…in a json…Generated with Agent Prompts…append…instructions” - “Create a new pages module…data module…move profile.ts…” - “Fix this warning…Vite CJS Node API is deprecated…” - “For the project details page I want a bunch more info…tech…what I learned…screenshot…live link…” - “create a new copilot skill that clones the git repo…scans…extracts project info” - Session Context: - Built and polished a GitHub Pages-deployed portfolio with a glassy 3D cube hero and interactive skill icons; added a prompt log + searchable viewer; refactored folder structure into pages/data; fixed build warnings; began enriching the project details page schema/UI. - User Intent Evolution: - Tooling + deployment → 3D portfolio experience → icon/UX polish → deployment fixes → prompt auditability and professional viewer → repo structure refactor → build warning cleanup → richer project detail pages + automated repo scanning. 2. Codebase Status (recently touched): - `src/data/projects.ts` - Purpose: Project data backing the Projects list and details pages. - Current State: Extended `Project` type with `liveUrl`, `screenshotUrl`, `techUsed`, `whatILearned`. - `src/pages/ProjectPage.tsx` - Purpose: Project detail page. - Current State: Now renders “View Live App”, screenshot, tech chips, and “What I learned” list when present. - `src/index.css` - Purpose: Global styling. - Current State: Added project detail styles (screenshot + chips + list). - Pending schema population: Existing project entries still need to be populated with the new fields. 4. [Chronological Review: Walk through conversation phases: initial request → exploration → implementation → debugging → current state]
- Phase 1 (Portfolio scaffolding + GH Pages): Set up a Vite + React app, migrated to TypeScript, added ESLint/Prettier, configured GitHub Pages deployment with `docs/` output, and adopted `HashRouter` for GH Pages compatibility.
- Phase 2 (3D hero + UI polish): Built a homepage with a React Three Fiber “glass cube” hero (with a transmission slider), improved navigation/interaction, and iterated on visuals.
- Phase 3 (Prompt logging + viewer): Implemented append-only logging of user prompts into `src/data/agent-prompts.json` and a searchable “Agent Prompts” viewer route/page; backfilled from a “full-chat” transcript.
- Phase 4 (Projects enrichment + automation): Extended the `Project` model and `ProjectPage` to support richer details (live links, screenshots, tech used, learnings, highlights). Packaged the “document a project” workflow into an Agent Skill under `.github/skills/project-documentation/` and built Node scripts to scan repos and auto-update `src/data/projects.ts`, including screenshot copying.
- Phase 5 (More projects + better detection): Added personal projects #2 and #3 from GitHub repos, improved README parsing and tech detection (Docker, Docker Compose, Postgres, Ollama, AWS Bedrock; including lockfile-based detection).
- Phase 6 (Work projects section + public-site screenshots): Added “Work Projects” as a separate data section and updated routing/lookups to support work project detail pages. Implemented a Playwright-based workflow to load public sites, auto-dismiss cookie/consent modals (including TrustArc), wait before capture, and generate both viewport and full-page screenshots. Used this to document EA store pages (Skate, Battlefield, Apex).
- Phase 7 (GH Pages workflow fixes): Updated GitHub Actions workflow versions to avoid deprecated artifact actions and later addressed (or prepared to address) deploy-pages v4 environment requirement.

[Intent Mapping: List each explicit user request with message context]
- Build a modern React site deployable to GitHub Pages; convert to TypeScript; remove JSX; add lint/lint:fix.
- Create a 3D portfolio homepage with a realistic glass rotating cube + slider and polished interactions.
- Log “all user inputs” into a JSON file and build a searchable viewer page; add append instructions.
- Improve project detail pages (tech used, learnings, screenshot, live link, benefit-focused highlights).
- Package repo-scanning/documentation instructions into an Agent Skill and scripts; add an updater to auto-populate projects.
- Add Personal Projects #2 and #3 by scanning specific GitHub repos and copying screenshots.
- Add Work Projects section and document EA webstores from public info, including public-site screenshots; later extend to Battlefield and Apex and ensure consistent tech stacks.
- Improve screenshot capture: wait before capture, close cookie/privacy modals (specifically TrustArc `#truste-consent-button`), capture full-page screenshots too.
- Fix GH Pages failures: first artifact action deprecation; then deploy-pages v4 “Missing environment” error.

[Technical Inventory: Catalog all technologies, patterns, and decisions mentioned]
- Frontend: Vite v5, React 18, TypeScript; routing via `react-router-dom` with `HashRouter`.
- 3D: three.js, @react-three/fiber, @react-three/drei; reusable `HeroScene` cube on multiple pages.
- Deployment: GitHub Pages with build output in `docs/`, `.nojekyll`, and base-path-safe assets via `import.meta.env.BASE_URL`.
- Logging: append-only JSON log (`src/data/agent-prompts.json`) + viewer page.
- Automation: Node `.cjs` scripts for repo scanning and updating TS data; extended tech detection heuristics.
- Public-site capture: Playwright (Chromium) headless screenshots with modal dismissal + delays; outputs stored under `public/project-screenshots/`.

[Code Archaeology: Document every file, function, and code change discussed]
- Project data + UI:
  - `src/data/projects.ts`: Defines `Project` type and arrays:
    - `projects` (personal) now includes:
      - `request-header-override`
      - `llm-doc-embeddings`
      - `llm-typescript-codebase-embeddings`
    - `workProjects` now includes:
      - `ea-skate-webstore` (with screenshot)
      - `ea-battlefield-webstore` (screenshot + tech stack updated to match Skate)
      - `ea-apex-webstore` (new; screenshot + full screenshot; same tech stack)
    - `allProjects` exported for unified lookup.
  - `src/pages/HomePage.tsx`: Updated to render “Personal Projects” and “Work Projects” sections separately; links to `#/projects/:slug`.
  - `src/pages/ProjectPage.tsx`: Uses `allProjects` to render both personal/work project detail pages; includes highlights above screenshot; modern framed screenshot styling; cube embedded.
- Project documentation skill + scripts:
  - `.github/skills/project-documentation/SKILL.md`: Instructions now include public URL screenshot capture and `--also-full-page`.
  - `.github/skills/project-documentation/scan-project-repo.cjs`: README parsing improvements (heading-to-bullets, code block stripping, whitespace normalization) + expanded tech detection including Docker, Compose, Postgres, Ollama, AWS Bedrock (including lockfile signals).
  - `.github/skills/project-documentation/update-project-from-repo.cjs`: Updates an existing project entry by slug with scan results; can copy screenshots from repos into `public/project-screenshots/`.
  - `.github/skills/project-documentation/capture-website-screenshot.cjs`: New Playwright-based screenshot capture:
    - Waits before capture (≈8s in latest iterations).
    - Best-effort dismissal of cookie/consent banners, including TrustArc via `#truste-consent-button` and `.truste-banner-close`.
    - Forces scroll-to-top before capture to avoid “bottom-of-page” shots.
    - Supports `--also-full-page` to produce `<slug>.png` and `<slug>-full.png`.
  - `scripts/capture-website-screenshot.cjs`: Wrapper to invoke the skill script.
  - `scripts/append-agent-prompt.cjs`: Used repeatedly to append prompts, including stdin mode to avoid shell/backtick issues.
- Assets:
  - `public/project-screenshots/*`: Added multiple screenshots from repos and public sites, including:
    - `ea-skate-webstore.png`, `ea-skate-webstore-full.png`
    - `ea-battlefield-webstore.png`, `ea-battlefield-webstore-full.png`
    - `ea-apex-webstore.png`, `ea-apex-webstore-full.png`
- GitHub Pages workflow:
  - `.github/workflows/deploy.yml`: Updated to new action versions and correct build artifact path:
    - `actions/upload-pages-artifact@v3` with `path: ./docs`
    - `actions/deploy-pages@v4`
    - deploy job requires `environment: name: github-pages` and sets `url: ${{ steps.deployment.outputs.page_url }}`
